intro: Cacalia appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Cacalia appendiculata is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
